personal.name: Dicle Ceylan
personal.title: Software Engineering Intern Candidate • Software Developer • Privacy & AI Researcher
personal.summary: Software Engineering Intern with experience in developing scalable software solutions and automation tools. Proficient in Python, C++, SQL, and REST API design. Skilled in cloud platforms, automation, cyber security fundamentals, and privacy engineering (PLDP).

details: Supporting digital transformation and analytics initiatives within the International Relations & Alliances Directorate.
Developing internal software tools and automation pipelines.
Enhancing data-driven decision-making in codeshare planning, network evaluation, and market analytics.

experience.role: Undergraduate Research Assistant — Personalized Local Differential Privacy (PLDP)
details: Conducting research on PLDP under Asst. Prof. Emre Gürsoy.
Developing algorithms, Python experiments, and benchmarking pipelines.
Co-authoring a manuscript submitted to ACM CODASPY 2026.
Completed training in offensive security, network analysis, OSINT, and exploit fundamentals.
Participated in scenario-based cyber range exercises.
Strengthened secure software development practices.
Worked with SQL Server, C#, REST APIs, microservice architecture.
Designed internal dashboards and JWT-based auth workflows.
Contributed to backend system improvements and SDLC processes.
Developed anomaly detection pipelines with SHAP & LIME explainability.
Conducted ML research for real estate and structured datasets.
Customer operations in a fast-paced hospitality environment.
Supported departmental academic and administrative tasks.

activities: IEEE Student Branch – Supervisor Board Member & Financial Director
